DataElement.preferredName: Biospecimen PAXgene Blood DNA Tube Ultra Low Temperature Freezer Transfer Person Name
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The name of the person that stored the PAXgene Blood DNA container in the format first initial last name.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Biospecimen PAXgene Blood DNA Tube Ultra Low Temperature Freezer Transfer
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._A blood collection tube that uses proprietary reagents for whole blood collection and stabilization prior to genomic DNA isolation._A type of freezer that can maintain temperatures between -80 and -86 degrees C._The act of conveying or transporting from one place to another.
